title: [BUG] Incompatible package versions when installing sktime[all_extras]
body:
**Describe the bug**

The dependency resolution of the packages installed by `sktime[all_extras]` fails.

**To Reproduce**

I am using `pip-tools` to manage the dependencies in a project.

Install `pip-tools` and run the dependency resolution on `sktime[all_extras]`.

```
pip install pip-tools
echo "sktime[all_extras]" > requirements.in
pip-compile
```

It fails with the following message:

```
Could not find a version that matches statsmodels<0.12,>=0.11,>=0.12.0,>=0.9.0 (from sktime[all_extras]==0.4.3->-r requirements.in (line 1))
Tried: 0.4.0, 0.4.0, 0.4.1, 0.4.1, 0.4.3, 0.4.3, 0.5.0, 0.5.0, 0.6.0, 0.6.0, 0.6.1, 0.6.1, 0.8.0, 0.9.0, 0.10.0, 0.10.1, 0.10.2, 0.10.2, 0.11.0, 0.11.0, 0.11.1, 0.11.1, 0.12.0, 0.12.0, 0.12.1, 0.12.1
Skipped pre-versions: 0.5.0rc1, 0.5.0rc1, 0.6.0rc1, 0.6.0rc1, 0.6.0rc2, 0.6.0rc2, 0.8.0rc1, 0.8.0rc1, 0.9.0rc1, 0.10.0rc2, 0.11.0rc1, 0.11.0rc1, 0.11.0rc2, 0.11.0rc2, 0.12.0rc0, 0.12.0rc0
There are incompatible versions in the resolved dependencies:
  statsmodels<0.12,>=0.11 (from pmdarima==1.7.1->sktime[all_extras]==0.4.3->-r requirements.in (line 1))
  statsmodels>=0.9.0 (from tsfresh==0.17.0->sktime[all_extras]==0.4.3->-r requirements.in (line 1))
  statsmodels>=0.12.0 (from sktime[all_extras]==0.4.3->-r requirements.in (line 1))
  statsmodels (from scikit-posthocs==0.6.6->sktime[all_extras]==0.4.3->-r requirements.in (line 1))
```

P.S.: Thanks for the project! The unified interface to dealing with time-series data is truly amazing!
